meanings.definition: The quality or state of being burdensome or oppressive.
meanings.sent1: The onerousnesses of carrying heavy bags made her tired.
meanings.sent2: The onerousnesses of the task made it hard to complete on time.
meanings.sent3: The onerousnesses of having to wear a heavy costume for the play was exhausting.
meanings.sent4: The onerousnesses of the strict rules felt like a weight on her shoulders.
meanings.sent5: The onerousnesses of the long journey through the mountains was like carrying a heavy load.

meanings.definition: The condition of involving a heavy or difficult burden.
meanings.sent1: The onerousnesses of the project required extra effort from the team.
meanings.sent2: The onerousnesses of the decision weighed heavily on his mind.
meanings.sent3: The onerousnesses of carrying all the groceries in one trip was a challenge.
meanings.sent4: The onerousnesses of the responsibility felt like a burden on his shoulders.
meanings.sent5: The onerousnesses of the task felt like a heavy weight dragging him down.

meanings.definition: The feeling of being weighed down by something difficult or demanding.
meanings.sent1: She felt the onerousnesses of the upcoming exam looming over her.
meanings.sent2: The onerousnesses of the situation made it hard to see a way out.
meanings.sent3: The onerousnesses of the never-ending chores made her want to escape.
meanings.sent4: The onerousnesses of the challenge felt like a heavy burden on her shoulders.
meanings.sent5: The onerousnesses of the difficult decision felt like a weight pressing down on her chest.
